member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.DecodeRequestLine(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unescape a URL path
member.param: The byte span represents a UTF8 encoding url path.
The byte span where unescaped url path is copied to.
Whether we are doing form encoding or not.
member.returns: The length of the byte sequence of the unescaped url path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.DecodeInPlace(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unescape a URL path in place.
member.param: The byte span represents a UTF8 encoding url path.
Whether we are doing form encoding or not.
member.returns: The number of the bytes representing the result.
member.remarks: The unescape is done in place, which means after decoding the result is the subset of the input span.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.DecodeCore(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unescape the percent-encodings
member.param: The iterator point to the first % char
Whether we are doing form encodoing

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.UnescapePercentEncoding(System.Int32@,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Read the percent-encoding and try unescape it.
The operation first peek at the character the iterator points at. If it is % the is then moved on to scan the following to characters. If the two following characters are hexadecimal literals they will be unescaped and the value will be returned.
If the first character is not % the iterator will be removed beyond the location of % and -1 will be returned.
If the following two characters can't be successfully unescaped the iterator will be move behind the % and -1 will be returned.
member.param: Whether we are decoding a form or not. Will escape '/' if we are doing form encoding
member.returns: The unescaped byte if success. Otherwise return -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.ReadHex(System.Int32@,System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary:
Read the next char and convert it into hexadecimal value.
The index will be moved to the next byte no matter whether the operation successes.
member.param: The index of the byte in the buffer to read
The byte span from which the hex to be read
member.returns: The hexadecimal value if successes, otherwise -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.DecodeRequestLine(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Char})
member.summary: Unescape a URL path
member.param: The escape sequences is expected to be well-formed UTF-8 code units.
The char span where unescaped url path is copied to.
member.returns: The length of the char sequence of the unescaped url path.
member.remarks: Form Encoding is not supported compared to the for performance gains, as current use-cases does not require it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.DecodeInPlace(System.Span{System.Char})
member.summary: Unescape a URL path in place.
member.param: The escape sequences is expected to be well-formed UTF-8 code units.
member.returns: The number of the chars representing the result.
member.remarks: The unescape is done in place, which means after decoding the result is the subset of the input span. Form Encoding is not supported compared to the for performance gains, as current use-cases does not require it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.DecodeCore(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Span{System.Char})
member.summary: Unescape the percent-encodings
member.param: The iterator point to the first % char

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.UnescapePercentEncoding(System.Int32@,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary:
Read the percent-encoding and try unescape it.
The operation first peek at the character the iterator points at. If it is % the is then moved on to scan the following to characters. If the two following characters are hexadecimal literals they will be unescaped and the value will be returned.
If the first character is not % the iterator will be removed beyond the location of % and -1 will be returned.
If the following two characters can't be successfully unescaped the iterator will be move behind the % and -1 will be returned.
member.returns: The unescaped char if success. Otherwise return -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.UrlDecoder.ReadHex(System.Int32@,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary:
Read the next char and convert it into hexadecimal value.
The index will be moved to the next char no matter whether the operation successes.
member.param: The index of the char in the buffer to read
The char span from which the hex to be read
member.returns: The hexadecimal value if successes, otherwise -1.

member.returns: A line.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebUtilities.FileBufferingReadStream
member.summary: A Stream that wraps another stream and enables rewinding by buffering the content as it is read. The content is buffered in memory up to a certain size and then spooled to a temp file on disk. The temp file will be deleted on Dispose.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

The maximum amount of bytes that the is allowed to buffer.

Provides the location of the directory to write buffered contents to. When unspecified, uses the value specified by the environment variable ASPNETCORE_TEMP if available, otherwise uses the value returned by .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebUtilities.StreamHelperExtensions
member.summary: HTTP extension methods for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebUtilities.StreamHelperExtensions.DrainAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Reads the specified to the end.
This API is effective when used in conjunction with buffering. It allows a buffered request stream to be synchronously read after it has been completely drained.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.summary:
Reads the specified to the end.
This API is effective when used in conjunction with buffering. It allows a buffered request stream to be synchronously read after it has been completely drained.
member.param: The maximum number of bytes to read. Throws if the is larger than this limit.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

Reads the specified to the end.
This API is effective when used in conjunction with buffering. It allows a buffered request stream to be synchronously read after it has been completely drained.
member.param: The byte array pool to use.
The maximum number of bytes to read. Throws if the is larger than this limit.
